Price-Based Indicators
Moving average lines are a frequently used to smooth the fluctuations in a price chart
(or a chart of any time series). A moving average is simply the mean of the last n closing
prices. The larger the chosen value of n, the smoother the moving average line. Analysts
often use moving average periods that make intuitive sense, such as 20 days to represent
the number of trading days in a month. In an uptrend, the price is higher than the
moving average, and in a downtrend, the price is lower than the moving average. Moving
average lines are often viewed as support or resistance levels.
